meanings.definition: A small, typically single-celled, structure in the skin that is filled with keratin and sebum.
meanings.sent1: The dermatologist explained that comedos are tiny skin structures filled with keratin and sebum.
meanings.sent2: She had a few comedos on her face, but they were easily treated with a gentle cleanser.
meanings.sent3: When the comedos decided to throw a party, the sebum was the life of the gathering.
meanings.sent4: Her face resembled a field of comedos, each one a tiny treasure trove of keratin and sebum.
meanings.sent5: The comedos on his nose looked like tiny volcanoes ready to erupt with keratin and sebum.

meanings.definition: A type of acne lesion characterized by a clogged hair follicle.
meanings.sent1: The dermatologist recommended a treatment to clear the comedos from her skin.
meanings.sent2: He struggled with comedos on his forehead, trying various remedies to unclog the hair follicles.
meanings.sent3: The comedos on her face seemed to have a secret mission to block every hair follicle in sight.
meanings.sent4: In the battle against acne, comedos were the sneaky soldiers clogging up the hair follicle trenches.
meanings.sent5: The mirror revealed a landscape of comedos, each one a stubborn blockage in a hair follicle.
